meanings.definition: To confine to a campus as punishment.
meanings.sent1: After breaking the rules, the student was campused and had to stay on campus.
meanings.sent2: The professor campused the student for skipping classes.
meanings.sent3: The student thought being campused was like being grounded but with more homework.
meanings.sent4: Being campused felt like being trapped in a school bubble.
meanings.sent5: The punishment of being campused made the student realize the importance of following the rules.

meanings.definition: To expel (a student) from a college or university.
meanings.sent1: The university campused the student for cheating on the exam.
meanings.sent2: She was campused for plagiarism in her research paper.
meanings.sent3: Getting campused was a wake-up call for the student to take academic integrity seriously.
meanings.sent4: Being campused was like being kicked out of the academic community.
meanings.sent5: The consequence of being campused made the student regret their dishonest actions.

meanings.definition: To restrict (a student) to the campus of a college or university as a disciplinary measure.
meanings.sent1: The dean campused the student for violating the code of conduct.
meanings.sent2: The student was campused for a week as a punishment.
meanings.sent3: Being campused meant missing out on off-campus events and activities.
meanings.sent4: Campusing the student was a way to ensure they learned their lesson.
meanings.sent5: The student felt isolated and lonely while being campused on campus.
